info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 12:33PM PDT until August 14 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 345 PM PDT. * At 1233 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Spring Mountains. A Rain gauge at Harris Springs reported an inch of rainfall in less than 30 minutes. Additional storm development is possible down to Red Rock Canyon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rainbow Canyon, Spring Mountains, Mt. Charleston, Red Rock Canyon, Summerlin, Kyle Canyon Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Hilltop Campground, Mahogany Grove Campground, Rocky Gap Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground and Mary Jane Falls Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
